member.name: T:EmailMarketing.API.Controllers.Internal.ErrorController
member.summary: INTERNAL API methods exposing base-channel

member.name: M:EmailMarketing.API.Controllers.Internal.ErrorController.GetInternal(System.Int32)
member.summary: Internal Get implementation returns Framework model
member.returns: internal Framework model object
member.remarks:
This breaks the pattern of delegating to the business layers as business layer doesn't support ApplicationLog.
Additionally, the Save() method (direct member of KM.Common.Entity.ApplicationLog) takes a ref to the object to be updated/deleted and sets the LogID of the referenced object, meaning it doesn't follow the typical business layer pattern.
For the moment POST is stubbed to deal directly with the existing logic in KM common however it might be better to extract the guts of GetInternal (coded here as GetById) out to the business and data layer methods, and also add typical BL/DL functionality for ApplicationLog.

member.summary: Transform an exception object into a standardized string suitable for logging

member.summary: Validates GroupID, LayoutID, FilterID (if present and greater than zero), determines if a smart-segment is used, and validates layout content. If issues are found, throws . member.summary: - This is the same as the existing ManageSubscriberWithProfile with an additional parameter of TriggerID. - This TriggerID needs to make it all the way to the Eventer as an optional parameter.If it is passed to the Eventer we would check to see if we have that in the database as a LayoutPlanID.If we do, we use that trigger. If we don't we follow the normal path and look for any other triggers on that group. - This method should not appear in the online documentation. - This method replaces the old AddSubscriberUsingSmartForm.

member.name: M:EmailMarketing.API.Controllers.EmailGroupController.ManageSubscriberWithDupeAndTrigger(EmailMarketing.API.Models.EmailGroup.ManageProfileWithDupeAndTrigger)
member.summary: - This is the same as the existing ManageSubscriberWithProfile with an additional parameter of TriggerID. It also must incorporate any logic necessary from the old web service we are replacing. - This TriggerID needs to make it all the way to the Eventer as an optional parameter.If it is passed to the Eventer we would check to see if we have that in the database as a LayoutPlanID.If we do, we use that trigger. If we don't we follow the normal path and look for any other triggers on that group. - This method should not appear in the online documentation. - This method replaces the old AddSubscriberWithDupesUsingSmartForm.

member.name: M:EmailMarketing.API.Controllers.EmailGroupController.UpdateEmailAddress(EmailMarketing.API.Models.EmailGroup.UpdateEmailAddress)
member.summary: Updates a subscribers Email Address by Master Suppressing the old Email Address and creating a new Email Address record with the old profile data. Note: This functions the same as the Email Marketing web site with the exception that this update is limited in scope to the Customer as opposed to the Base Channel. When you submit the request an email is sent to the old email address asking them to confirm the change to their new email address. Until the recipient verifies the change the email address will not be updated in ECN.

If the email address is associated with the given group we will return standard profile fields as well as their relationship to the group and any UDF data.
